chargeHist.descr: PTC Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Allan J. PERRY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Joyriding [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The State files an Amended Information which amends the charge to misdemeanor operate without owner's consent-joyriding, contrary to Section 943.23(3m) of the Wisconsin Statutes. 
GUILTY plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The Court sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for forty-five (45) days, time already served.
Defendant has credit for 44 days.
$443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 11-12-14 or 9 days county jail for failure to pay.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of PTC operate without owner's consent.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-03-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the conditions that  he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with Ryan Reynolds and Timothy Gadzinski and he must provide an address to the clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.
